dct_title_s: A new & accurate map of the western parts of Barbary, : containing Fez, Morocco, Algiers, Tunis & Biledulgerid
dct_description_sm: 2 maps on 1 sheet; each 17 x 43 cm

Drawn from the best authorities & regulated by astron.l observations by Eman. Bowen. A new & accurate map of the eastern parts of Barbary, containing Tripoli, Barca, Faisan and the northern parts of Egypt, with the adjacent countries / Drawn from the best authorities & regulated by astron.l observat.ns by Eman.l Bowen ; Scale 1:7,750,000 ; Prime meridian: London ; Numbered 'No. 60.' ; Shows boundaries, rivers, islands and principal settlements, with tent symbols for areas inhabited by nomads ; Relief shown pictorially ; Covers North Africa from the Madera Islands to the Red Sea ; London : E. Bowen
dct_rights_sm: The images on this web site, from maps in the collection of the Melville J. Herskovits Library of African Studies and housed in the Government & Geographic Information Collection of Northwestern University Libraries are in the public domain in the United States, and as such, not subject to copyright restriction. The Libraries request users cite both the URL and Northwestern University Libraries if they wish to reproduce images from the repository. For access to higher resolution images please contact repository@northwestern.edu
